intro: Heterodraba unilateralis, commonly known as the single-sided flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are linear and often have a distinct, single-sided appearance, which gives it its common name. Heterodraba unilateralis is known for its resilience and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
